articles.title: DPRK Delegate Calls for Providing Environment for Sustainable Development
Norwegian King on Korean Reunification
Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics Praised
articles.content:
Norwegian King on Korean Reunification 
    Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Harald V, king of Norway, when receiving credentials from the new DPRK ambassador to his country on Oct. 15, expressed hope that all the issues of the Korean peninsula including the issue of reunification would be settled peacefully.
 He also hoped that the friendly relations between Norway and the DPRK would extensively develop in political, economic and other fields in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Additional Troop Dispatch to Iraq Protested in S. Korea
New Books off the Press
Congratulations to Azerbaijani President
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Congratulations to Azerbaijani President 
    Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Oct. 19 sent a congratulatory message to Ilham Aliyev upon his election as president of Azerbaijan.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples and wished the president great success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: S. Korea's Moves for Additional Troop Dispatch to Iraq Assailed
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam 
    Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Abd. Hamid Bin Haji Abd Jalil, new ambassador of Brunei Darussalam to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung.    
 After receiving credentials, the president conversed with the ambassador.

articles.title: Kim Il Chol Meets Chinese Delegation
Chinese State Delegation to Visit DPRK Soon
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol Meets Chinese Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Vice-Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, today
met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of officers in charge of diplomatic affairs of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Jia Xiaoning, vice-director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Defense Ministry.    
 Present there were generals and officers of the KPA, the charge d'affaires ad interim and the military attache of the Chinese embassy here.
